ude.SocialMediaExplorer.data.utils.time

Class TimeSpan

  • java.lang.Object
    • ude.SocialMediaExplorer.data.utils.time.TimeSpan

  • public class TimeSpan
extends java.lang.Object
    helper class to represent an time interval Usage: for dates: TimeSpan t = new TimeSpan( Date1, (Date2) ); t.inDays() // returns day difference between 1 and 2 TimeSpan t = new TimeSpan().setDays(3); //=from now till in 3 days Date d = t.getEnd(); for consversion of "normal" intervals long ms = new TimeSpan().setHours(2).inMilliseconds();
    Author:
    henrikdetjen
